metadata.TITLE: Catch Up On The Latest News Clips - ITVX
metadata.DESC: Discover the latest and breaking news clips from ITV. ITVX - The UK's freshest streaming service.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The latest ITV News headlines - as Netanyahu vows to fight until victory in Gaza
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch a short summary of today's top stories from the ITV News team

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Lord Cameron: 'Ongoing process' to review weapons sales to Israel
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The Foreign Secretary said the UK had a 'rigorous legal process' as he defended his decision not to pause arms sales to Israel.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Eurovision boss booed in controversy-laden night in Malmo
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The contest was won by Switzerland's Nemo, who said they hoped the contest could 'live up to its promise to stand up for peace' in their victory speech.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Natalie Elphicke accused of lobbying justice secretary to interfere in husband’s sex offence trial
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The Tory defector is alleged to have inappropriately pressured the Justice Secretary to help with her husband's case in 2020, a claim Elphicke denies.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Working parents of children over nine-months-old can now apply for childcare allowance
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The government's expansion of funded childcare has continued with working parents of children over nine-months-old now able to apply for the scheme.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: MPs call for tax on stadium concerts to help smaller venues
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: A group of cross-party MPs says artists are facing a 'cost-of-touring crisis' as promoters struggle to make shows financially viable.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Further Rafah evacuations ordered after U.S. says Israel 'likely' violated international law
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: A U.S. report stated it is 'reasonable to assess' there may have been some breaches but said it did not have all the necessary information.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: M25 closure: Everything you need to know as major motorway shuts for second time
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The UK's busiest motorway will close again, this time between Junction 9 at Leatherhead and Junction 10 for the A3.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: How farms are being targeted by criminal gangs stealing machinery to order for Russia
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: ITV News has been shown figures which reveal the surge in demand for heavy machinery since the invasion of Ukraine and subsequent sanctions.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Trump on Trial: All the analysis after Stormy Daniel's graphic testimony
The Rundown: ITV News' daily update for teenagers
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch a new edition of The Rundown every afternoon.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Sunny with a chance of thunderstorms: Watch the latest ITV forecast
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch the latest UK forecast from the ITV Weather team.
Watch the latest bulletin from ITV News.

clips.episodeTitle: Lord Cameron: 'Ongoing process' to review weapons sales to Israel
clips.synopsis: The Foreign Secretary said the UK had a 'rigorous legal process' as he defended his decision not to pause arms sales to Israel.

clips.episodeTitle: Rwanda plan out, anti-terror powers in: Starmer unveils small boats strategy
clips.synopsis: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has unveiled his party's plans to tackle small boat crossings in the channel and scrap the Rwanda policy.

clips.episodeTitle: Rishi Sunak tells ITV News 'the economy has real momentum' as UK exits recession
clips.synopsis: The UK economy grew by 0.6% in the last quarter, boosted by retail, public transport, and car manufacturing.

clips.episodeTitle: 'Is Nigel Farage welcome in Labour?' Starmer pressed on Tory defection
clips.synopsis: Labour MPs have privately expressed concern about who is allowed into the Labour Party following the defection of Dover MP Natalie Elphicke on Wednesday.

clips.episodeTitle: Rwanda plan out, anti-terror powers in: Starmer unveils small boats strategy
clips.synopsis: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has unveiled his party's plans to tackle small boat crossings in the channel and scrap the Rwanda policy.

clips.episodeTitle: PM meets university leaders to call for end to antisemitic abuse on campuses
clips.synopsis: Student encampments have been set up at more than a dozen universities in the UK against the war in Gaza. Ministers want more done to protect Jewish students.

clips.episodeTitle: Natalie Elphicke apologises for comments about ex-husband's sexual assault victims
clips.synopsis: Ms Elphicke’s former husband and predecessor as MP for Dover, Charlie Elphicke, was convicted in 2020 of sexually assaulting two women and jailed for two years.

clips.episodeTitle: Conservative MP Nadhim Zahawi to stand down at next general election
clips.synopsis: The former chancellor, who has been the MP for Stratford-Upon-Avon for 14 years, said it was time for a "new, energetic Conservative" to take over.

clips.episodeTitle: Shock and unease among MPs after 'right-wing Tory' Natalie Elphicke defects
clips.synopsis: Natalie Elphicke, the MP for Dover, said "under Rishi Sunak, the Conservatives have become a byword for incompetence and division."

clips.episodeTitle: Rishi Sunak claims UK heading for hung parliament in wake of local election losses
clips.synopsis: The Prime Minister has been urged to change course by many in his party after the Conservatives lost almost half of their council seats.

clips.episodeTitle: West Midlands mayoral election: Labour's Richard Parker beats Conservative Andy Street
clips.synopsis: Lewis Warner has the story of the West Midlands mayoral election, as Labour’s Richard Parker narrowly beats Andy Street in a huge blow for the Conservatives.

clips.episodeTitle: Labour's Sadiq Khan wins historic third term as London Mayor
clips.synopsis: Mr Khan said he faced a campaign of 'non-stop negativity', but he couldn’t be more proud to 'answer the fearmongering with facts'.

clips.episodeTitle: Local Elections 2024: Labour gains and Conservative losses pile pressure on PM
clips.synopsis: The Prime Minister has called local election results "disappointing" for his party after Labour made strong gains across the country.

clips.episodeTitle: Eurovision boss booed in controversy-laden night in Malmo
clips.synopsis: The contest was won by Switzerland's Nemo, who said they hoped the contest could 'live up to its promise to stand up for peace' in their victory speech.

clips.episodeTitle: Further Rafah evacuations ordered after U.S. says Israel 'likely' violated international law
clips.synopsis: A U.S. report stated it is 'reasonable to assess' there may have been some breaches but said it did not have all the necessary information.

clips.episodeTitle: Russian forces launch attack on Ukrainian city of Kharkiv
clips.synopsis: Thousands of troops tried to break through Ukrainian defences near the border before they were halted.

clips.episodeTitle: Joe Biden threatens to halt weapons supply if Israel launches Rafah offensive
clips.synopsis: President Joe Biden has warned Israel that the U.S. will stop supplying some weapons if it launches a major ground operation in the city of Rafah.

clips.episodeTitle: Israel continues strikes near Rafah despite U.S. halting bomb shipments
clips.synopsis: Aid agencies have warned of dire consequences after the Rafah border crossing in southern Gaza was forced to close.

clips.episodeTitle: Trump trial: Stormy Daniels details alleged sexual encounter with former president
clips.synopsis: Stormy Daniels says she met Trump at a celebrity golf tournament in 2006 and was then invited to have dinner with him. Trump denies having any sexual encounter.

clips.episodeTitle: Aid charities warn of crisis as Israel takes control of Rafah crossing
clips.synopsis: Israel is pressing ahead with targeted strikes in Eastern Rafah after Hamas issued a statement saying it accepts a ceasefire agreement.

clips.episodeTitle: Israeli army tells 100,000 Palestinians to evacuate parts of Rafah ahead of expected assault
clips.synopsis: The Israeli army says this is a 'limited scope' operation and has not confirmed if this is part of a larger scale invasion of the Southern Gazan city.

clips.episodeTitle: Gaza ceasefire negotiations stall as Israel brands Hamas' demands 'unacceptable'
clips.synopsis: The Israeli Prime Minister said Hamas' demands for a permanent ceasefire would leave the group 'intact', which he said was 'unacceptable'.

clips.episodeTitle: Rescuers smash through roof to rescue baby in flood-hit Brazil
clips.synopsis: Some cities in southern Brazil are seeing water levels that are at their highest 'since records began'.

clips.episodeTitle: Donald Trump's former aide Hope Hicks gives evidence at 'hush money' trial
clips.synopsis: Hope Hicks was previously Trump's campaign spokesperson. She told the court her response to scandals like the Access Hollywood tape was "deny, deny, deny".

clips.episodeTitle: China launches space mission to collect samples from 'far side of the moon'
clips.synopsis: The Chang'e-6 probe blasted off this morning and aims to collect 2kg of samples from the side of the moon that can't be viewed from Earth, in a world-first.

clips.episodeTitle: Arrests made at UCLA as police clash with pro-Palestinian students across the U.S.
clips.synopsis: Chaotic scenes played out at UCLA as police officers in riot gear surged against crowds of demonstrators, leading to numerous arrests.

clips.episodeTitle: How farms are being targeted by criminal gangs stealing machinery to order for Russia
clips.synopsis: ITV News has been shown figures which reveal the surge in demand for heavy machinery since the invasion of Ukraine and subsequent sanctions.

clips.episodeTitle: World Cup legend Sir Geoff Hurst setting out to tackle scourge of scammers
clips.synopsis: The 1966 World Cup hattrick hero says he has been the target of scams and wants to help his generation embrace, rather than fear, technology.

clips.episodeTitle: Eurovision 2024: Israel's contestant 'honoured' to represent country despite boycott calls
clips.synopsis: Despite large demonstrations planned to coincide with the event, Eden Golan says she "couldn't ask for a better year to represent" Israel.

clips.episodeTitle: Family of pregnant mother killed by a dangerous driver hope to educate young motorists
clips.synopsis: Frankie Jules-Hough was killed by Adil Iqbal who was steering with one hand and filming himself speeding with the other.

clips.episodeTitle: Dramatic rise in new and expectant mothers receiving mental health support
clips.synopsis: Data from NHS England shows that more than 57 thousand women received treatment in the past year - that's up a third compared to the year before.

clips.episodeTitle: 'I tasted death': The shocking rise in NHS workers being assaulted while on shift
clips.synopsis: An NHS nurse has spoken for the first time about almost being strangled to death by a patient, as figures show a 21% rise in violent assaults since 2019.

clips.episodeTitle: The horrors of Gaza: The tragic story of a boy who has lost both his family and limbs
clips.synopsis: 3-year-old Ahmad lost his parents and both legs in an Israeli airstrike at the start of the Israel-Hamas war, leaving his home in Gaza for treatment.

clips.episodeTitle: 'She was the best mum': Daughter of Sharon Beshenivsky speaks to ITV News about her mother
clips.synopsis: The daughter of PC Sharon Beshenivsky, who was shot dead on duty nearly 20 years ago, tells ITV News she's been living in "a tunnel of darkness" ever since.

clips.episodeTitle: Fire service bosses talked about wanting to 'kill' and harm female colleagues
clips.synopsis: Shropshire Fire and Rescue Service's chief fire officer and assistant chief fire officer sent messages suggesting they wanted to harm female colleagues.

clips.episodeTitle: Young support for Tories worse than during Blair's 1997 landslide, poll shows
clips.synopsis: An exclusive poll for ITV has revealed just 14% of 18-25 year olds say they will vote Conservative at the next general election.

clips.episodeTitle: 'When I grow up I'll make them pay': Israel-Gaza war spreading anger down generations
clips.synopsis: The conflict unfolding between Israel and Gaza is creating mutual hatred among many young Israelis and Palestinians.

clips.episodeTitle: 'No justice': Widow of subpostmaster who took his own life was denied compensation
clips.synopsis: Gowri Jayakanthan has spoken to ITV News about how she blames the Post Office for her husband taking his own life, and how she has been denied compensation.

clips.episodeTitle: 'The sound of gunfire is constant': Inside the British field hospital in Gaza
clips.synopsis: Local journalists have filmed on behalf of ITV News inside a British-run field hospital in Gaza, where medics say the sounds of war nearby are near-constant.

clips.episodeTitle: M25 closure: Everything you need to know as major motorway shuts for second time
clips.synopsis: The UK's busiest motorway will close again, this time between Junction 9 at Leatherhead and Junction 10 for the A3.

clips.episodeTitle: After another extraordinary day of evidence against Trump, who is Stormy Daniels?
clips.synopsis: Who is the adult film star at the centre of Donald Trump's hush money trial?

clips.episodeTitle: Why is Macron offering free fertility checks to young people in France?
clips.synopsis: France's birth rate fell to the country's lowest level since World War Two in 2023, prompting Macron to unveil new measures he hopes will reverse the trend.

clips.episodeTitle: Who are the people deciding if Donald Trump is guilty?
clips.synopsis: We don't know the identities of the jurors in Trump's hush money trial, but we do know some of their jobs, backgrounds, and general opinions on politics.

clips.episodeTitle: Controversy and high security: Everything you need to know about Eurovision 2024
clips.synopsis: Planned demonstrations over Israel's inclusion in this year's Eurovision Song Contest have added to already heightened security concerns.

clips.episodeTitle: Why has Rafah become a focal point of the Israel-Gaza war?
clips.synopsis: Israel has ordered thousands of people to leave eastern Rafah and Israeli forces say they have taken control of the Rafah crossing - a vital aid route.

clips.episodeTitle: The key results to look out for at Local Elections 2024
clips.synopsis: ITV News Deputy Political Editor Anushka Asthana takes a look at the key battleground seats which could signal how the main parties are faring.

clips.episodeTitle: Who is John Swinney and what will his government look like?
clips.synopsis: John Swinney has been elected as the new SNP leader and will likely become the First Minister of Scotland.

clips.episodeTitle: What public events is King Charles expected to attend this summer?
clips.synopsis: After the King carried out his first public event since his cancer treatment, when can we expect to see him over the coming months?

clips.episodeTitle: Who could replace Humza Yousaf as Scotland's next First Minister?
clips.synopsis: After Scotland's First Minister Humza Yousaf announced he's stepping down, the SNP must hold its second leadership contest in barely a year.

clips.episodeTitle: Local elections 2024: What is happening on Thursday 2nd May?
clips.synopsis: Local elections will be taking place across 107 local authorities in England, with voters selecting more than 2,500 councillors, and 10 metro mayors.

clips.episodeTitle: What is the PM's new pledge on defence and how does UK spending compare to other countries?
clips.synopsis: Rishi Sunak has announced billions in extra defence spending which, he says, will put the country on a "war footing" with the world at its "most dangerous".

clips.episodeTitle: Impact of the pandemic to lower grades and widen social divisions into the 2030s
clips.synopsis: Academics are warning that the impacts of the Covid-19 pandemic on education will cause lower grades and widen socio-economic gaps as late as next decade.

clips.episodeTitle: A sports day with a difference - the USAF base inviting people with disabilities to compete
clips.synopsis: The event took place at RAF Mildenhall - just as it has done every year for the last four decades

clips.episodeTitle: 104-year-old gets her own private cavalcade ahead of Liberation Day
clips.synopsis: Helene Galienne from Guernsey got to experience the Liberation celebrations early after a change of route to the 2024 cavalcade meant it would miss her home.

clips.episodeTitle: 'People survived by helping each other': Occupation survivor reflects on ring given by slave worker
clips.synopsis: Michael Vautier's parents risked their lives to ensure slave workers were cared for and recounts how one of them handcrafted a ring to show his gratitude.

clips.episodeTitle: Critically endangered eel and shark among species identified along Sussex coastline
clips.synopsis: Researchers from the University of Sussex recorded the different creatures living under the water across 28 survey sites between Shoreham-by-Sea and Selsey.

clips.episodeTitle: 'No Mow May' campaign: Why gardeners are being encouraged to let their grass grow
clips.synopsis: The annual 'No Mow May' campaign begins on Wednesday, to encourage gardeners to let their grass grow to help the bees, butterflies and other wildlife.

clips.episodeTitle: Oscar-winning actress Cate Blanchett lends her support to the botanical gardens in Sussex
clips.synopsis: Scientists at the Millennium Seed Bank are looking at new ways to fight the disease that's destroying our ash trees

clips.episodeTitle: Myths and mysteries of Shakespeare's real-life women uncovered in new exhibition
clips.synopsis: An exhibition in Shakespeare's birthplace in Stratford-upon-Avon is uncovering stories of the women who shaped his life, as Charlotte Cross reports.

clips.episodeTitle: Blackpool Rock 'under severe threat' from imported Chinese imitations
clips.synopsis: Blackpool rock-makers have said they are facing a 'grave and immediate challenge' after a recent influx of cheap Chinese imports has seen local factories close.

clips.episodeTitle: Meet the trio of birds born at a bird sanctuary in the Scottish Borders
clips.synopsis: These flightless birds are native to Australia and can weigh up to 55kg when fully grown.

clips.episodeTitle: The hidden history of Hartlepool's floating museum, the HMS Trincomalee
clips.synopsis: This week in 1816 work began on the HMS Trincomalee in Mumbai, India. Now, more than two centuries later, the ship's found a home in Hartlepool as a museum.

clips.episodeTitle: How the Historic Dockyard Chatham has become a popular location for film and TV
clips.synopsis: It's 40 years since the site closed - an area with 400 years of shipbuilding heritage  - and it's now a popular attraction with visitors from across the world

clips.episodeTitle: The Suffolk village that has a familiar feel for the US servicemen and women living there
clips.synopsis: The currency, cars and accents around RAF Mildenhall all help the visiting military personnel feel a little more at home

clips.episodeTitle: How the peaceful place of pilgrimage became a silver screen set
clips.synopsis: The World Heritage Site has been transformed into a magical school and a royal palace

longformData.description: GMB's Richard Arnold meets Ryan Gosling & Emily Blunt at the UK premiere!

longformData.title: The Post Office Scandal: From the ITV News Archives
longformData.description: The ITV News archives reveal the real-life stories behind 'Mr Bates vs The Post Office'.

longformData.title: Ukraine's Stolen Children
longformData.description: Compelling story of the children taken to Russia after war broke out

longformData.title: Wed 1st May
longformData.description: The panel discuss the political upheaval in Scotland and Rishi Sunak's Rwanda plan.

longformData.title: Wed 24th Apr
longformData.description: On the day that Angela Rayner takes centre stage in the House of Commons.

longformData.title: Wed 8th May
longformData.description: Get the latest as Conservative MP Natalie Elphicke defects to Labour

longformData.title: Weds 17th Apr
longformData.description: On the day that Rishi Sunak faces jibes from the opposition about Liz Truss.

longformData.title: Week 1
longformData.description: The case, the jury and the ex-President - get the latest with Tom Bradby

longformData.title: Week 2
longformData.description: Rageh Omaar and guests discuss the latest courtroom drama.

longformData.title: Week 3
longformData.description: Geraint Vincent is joined by an expert panel for all the courtroom drama

longformData.title: Week 3
longformData.description: Stormy Daniels took centre stage in another extraordinary week
